publication.abstract: Summary: We present here a neural network based method for prediction of N-terminal acetylation - by far the most abundant post-translational modification in eukaryotes. The method was developed on a yeast dataset for N-acetyltransferase A (NatA) acetylation, which is the type of N-acetylation for which most examples are known and for which orthologs have been found in several eukaryotes. We obtain correlation coefficients close to 0.7 on yeast data and a sensitivity up to 74% on mammalian data, suggesting that the method is valid for eukaryotic NatA orthologs. Â© The Author 2004. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.
publication.title: NetAcet: Prediction of N-terminal acetylation sites

summary.description: Prediction of substrates of N-acetyltransferase A (NatA).
summary.name: NetAcet
